posts.name: Ishan Sinha
posts.cooked:
Hey Delphi! Some of my friends and I from local teams around FIM are trying to build a robot completely autonomous from our teams (no support from any of our teams). We have attained a sponsorship to help us get this robot done and powder coated, but we are now faced with the challenge of purchasing robot parts. If any of you have spares of the parts listed below, please reach out to @steggs85 or I. We are willing to purchase for up to retail price and pay for shipping. Here are the parts:

PDH and Breakers

REV Throughbore Encoder

8 Neos

NavX MXP (not 2)

2 Max 90 Degree Gearboxes

Battery Chargers

If there is anything else that you could sell to us under retail either, that’d be a massive help, so please reach out!

Thanks and robot on everyone!

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
Is-han-solo:

Battery Chargers

I don’t have any of these items in a state to part with them, but this seemed too easy.

5.5 Amp 12 Volt battery chargers for lead acid, SLA, VRLA, Gel, and 		AGM Batteries, CE, TUV, 12V 5A is the one we run on 1293 (and I got it from 3847).

https://www.harborfreight.com/4-amp-fully-automatic-microprocessor-controlled-battery-chargermaintainer-63350.html can be had for less at any Harbor Freight for $40; $30 if you go today with the 25% off coupon they’ve spammed me with.

In either case, just convert the clamps to SB-50 connectors.

posts.name: Ishan Sinha
posts.cooked: Thank you! We will for sure check it out!

posts.name: Carter Steggerda
posts.cooked:
Update: we have leads on neos, spark maxes, a battery charger, we ordered a pdp, and for some reason I missed that the thru bore encoder was in stock.

However we still are looking for some sort of gyro (Pigeon 2.0 or a NavX MXP) and a Max 90 Degree Gearbox.

posts.name: Ayush Garg
posts.cooked: Do you need it to be a mint NavX or are you fine with it being used and still good quality.

posts.name: Ishan Sinha
posts.cooked: Fine with good quality, but may not pay full price as if new… but that is tbd, we can discuss in dms

posts.name: Ishan Sinha
posts.cooked: Update: We are only now looking for a Max 90 degree gearbox. Please dm if anyone is willing to part ways with one. We are willing to pay for shipping as well.
